caption: Great food poor customer service.  In all honesty they could have been busy but at the very least you can greet your customers.   Some customers he did run to greet as seen in the picture
Great food wonderful. Not much parking, lots of Doordash and Uber eats taking the limited parking on 5th st. All in all its a great place to eat from.

They were awesome, but they keep changing their recipes on multiple dishes, so I might stop going there. I go there for a certain thing, expecting the same thing, and then it's dramatically different.
Tasty dishes and huge portions. Highly recommended!
Just ate here for the first time. As a lover of indian food this was seasoned perfectly. SPICY AS IT SHOULD BE. If you have a problem with spice or the taste, maybe you should be eating at McDonalds.
I like the portions but I had to eat it in small phases because how spicy it was. Shame, I’d go back if it wasn’t too spicy. Can’t do it again until I see an option to customize spice.
Went for the first time last night. Prices are Great! The food is Really Good and Spicy! Definitely will be going back!

Sad & pathetic attempt to capitalize on Indigo's success. You will have a much better experience walking down the block for way better Indian food. What is the point of more "value" when the quality is sub-par? Hard pass.
Nice chicken and the sauce is great!

Not an expert but a big fan of indian food, i tried the butter and tiki masala chicken with rice, peas and spinach. The portion was exaggerated and the food was bland.  Wouldn't mind a smaller portion with more flavor, and spicy, i think that is pretty obvious judging by the other comments.  They need to ask customers right there on the spot what they thought about their food and take the suggestions constructively and improve the product. I wouldn't give less than 3 stars because i don't want to affect local businesses rating but they are miles away from their local direct competitors Spice6.
To damn spicy. Besides the main dish  and that is still mild spicy.
Horrible dishes. They made a mockery of Indian food. Nothing was restaurant quality.

My favorite place for Indian food in DC. A small menu, but it's all that's necessary. The food is SPICY, so beware- you can't customize the spice level. Portions are enormous, I usually get 3 meals out of this. Excellent value!

3 things to know before eating here! --- 1) You better like spicy 2) Big appetites will be satisfied 3) To Go traveled well  ---  The good Affordable Indian cuisine in a fast food style. Came in made ordered, got my food and left in under 10 mins.  ---  The bad Not necessarily a bad thing but just something to know. All the ingredients in my plate were spicy! Like 8 - 8.5 almost 9 lol. I enjoyed it but definitely not for those who turn red from a little black pepper lol  ---  The entrees I ordered the butter chicken ( my favorite) and asked for a piece of chicken Tika masala  to make sure I wasn't missing anything.  Enjoyed the butter chicken more. The gravy was rich and although it had a sweeter forward taste than the masla, it was just as hot!  The chana was cool. I'm not to crazy about chickpeas so there's that. And the vegetable biriani was good as well. The plate comes with rice already so kinda wish I would've gotten the spinach to round it out.  All in all I would get quick bite to eat here again.

This is very hard to review since the value is second-to-none:  they basically give you two meals worth of food for slightly more than $10, and the food in general is pretty good.  I especially how much meat they included in their curries.  If you do go here, the mango lassi, the chicken dishes, and the Palak paneer are definitely the items that are worth getting -- I'd say they're all above average for an Indian restaurant in this price category.  However, the service is disorganized and slow even when there aren't many other people in the restaurant, and there's no option for a half-portion so it's hard to go here with others without wasting a lot of extra food at the end of the meal.  They also don't let you choose the spice level, which varies considerably across the entrees and is spicier than my absolute preference for some of the dishes.  I appreciate that this is probably more a testament to my own personal low spice tolerance than anything about this restaurant, but it is disappointing given that there are only five or so entrees offered that additional ones will be knocked off the menu for either being too spicy or not spicy enough depending on your preference for heat.  The chana masala and the biryanai were below average as well.  Overall, I'd recommend it for people with a high spice tolerance who are looking for a giant meal for a reasonable price, but if you just want great Indian food I'd recommend choosing another place in the area.  You might pay the same amount for less food but you'll be able to choose what dish you get and how much you want to eat in the meal.
The chicken is well cooked and delicious with the tasty sauce that they adding to chicken, I like it! Thanks!

This place is my first choice restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to that place. Whenever  I I need a fair dinner, this restaurant comes straightaway to my head. very good and   food and a large list of dishes.well mannered crew, and agreeable vibes. And very important, the charge is reasonable. I recommend this spot with no doubt.

Last year, Butter Chicken Company opened in downtown Washington, D.C. with a unique concept- make 300 dishes of food and serve until it runs out. With the same concept, Butter Chicken Company 2 opened on H Street N.E.  When you walk in, you'll notice the giant vats of food slowly cooking. Inside are the few dishes they sell. They make butter chicken and chicken tikka masala as the mains and saag paneer, channa masala and vegetable biryani as the sides. For only $11, you get an entree, two sides and naan. It's enough to feed you two meals easily. The food is a little spicy with the chicken tikka masala spicier than the butter chicken. For drinks, they have bottled options including Honest Tea.  The inside is spacious with tables and the outside has an outdoor table. However, all seating is closed during COVID-19.
Great portions but every dish has a weird aftertaste I honestly don’t know what it is, but it makes the dish hardly edible.
Great portions, great price, great taste!! a bit too spicy for the average person I would say and I wish they had more dishes or a rotating menu.
Great food, big portion, fantastic value.  Shout out to great customer service, they chased us down for two blocks after we forgot our credit card.  Can't wait to visit again!

The amount of food you get for 11 bucks is extraordinary. I like to eat, but I was absolutely stuffed after getting through half of the dish. Two side dishes and naan included! And this is super good fast casual Indian food too. Just a few items on the menu (more than just butter chicken though!), but they're really good.
Lol I come once a week. Incredible meal and value.

This restaurant is phenomenal, which is what you’d expect from the masters at Bombay Street Food. Consistently pleasant service and the best butter chicken I’ve ever ate for an awesome value. If you want butter chicken this is your best option in the city.

This is a fantastic place to get takeaway during the shutdown: you don't even have to order ahead - just turn up and you will have your food in no time! The food is really delicious, and the portions are really big so it's great value for money. We love both the butter chicken and the chicken tikka masala. The staff are very friendly too.
Delicious and HUGE portions
Great value for the price! Well spiced! Excellent customer service. Will definitely be back. Thanks for being flexible during these difficult times.

Portions were great, but unfortunately everything was way too spicy for me (I am a wimp with spicy foods, so this may not be an issue for others). I've only ever had mild butter chicken and viewed it as a reliable non-spicy dish, so I was very surprised at my first bite! I also asked the person serving me for the mildest sides and they still ended up being too spicy for me (I chose paneer and biryani). I still ate everything because flavors were good, but slightly unpleasant experience.

Despite the limited menu being a little sad (Only 1 major vegetarian entree) this food is absolutely delicious. I wish I could order just a side of the vegetable rice sometimes when I'm coming home because the meal size is very large and sometimes all I want is a little order of the veggie rice. An order is an entree with 2 sides and the portion is big enough that I can easily save half of it for a later meal or lunch the next day. Best Paneer I've ever had actually. The food is probably a little spicy for white people and wimps like myself but it clears my sinuses and makes me feel warm for the rest of the day during this chilly winter weather so I'm not really complaining.

I was excited to try this place as a huge fan of Indian food and someone local to the area. It was, however, a disastrous disappointment.  The saag paneer i ordered tasted like frozen spinach hastily mixed without the correct spices or cream, chief amongst those absent is salt.  The sides offered are chana masala (chickpeas) and spicy biryani. The chana masala is at least palatable, but both dishes are way too spicy. Every dish has a weird artificial flavor that is honestly repulsive. I tried eating the leftovers of my meal the next day but lost my appetite for everything save the chickpeas.  If you want a good Indian meal, try Indigo on 3rd and K. You can smell the cumin from that place a block away, as they are definitely getting their spices right, especially on vegetarian dishes.  Sad to see Red Boat replaced by such a thoughtless effort to leech off of Indigo’s popularity and the rise of Indian cuisine.

Butter chicken was good. Much better than other Indian restaurants, to the liking of Indians. Wasn't expecting much from saag paneer, and have to admit it surprised me. Liked the veg biryani side too. Sauces were outstanding! Will go back to try chicken tikka masala.
Fantastic. Complex flavors, great spices, honestly....may be better than Indigo....

Have been looking forward to them opening for weeks! Food was great, had the Butter chicken and the Tikka Masala, both with chana and biryani. Tikka was a bit more spicy, butter chicken more creamy, both really good.
